info.title: Customer Order
info.description: The Customer Order API enables you to create and manage utilities retailer specific needs, such as customer order creation. The API also allows you to configure customer order related objects, such as division, shipping conditions, sales processing status, and so on.

get.summary: Retrieves customer orders.

get.description: Retrieves a single customer order with a specific identifier.

patch.description: Updates a single customer order with a specific identifier.

post.description: Closes a single customer order with a specific identifier. This request will update the end of business date of the order, that is, the closed date or the date of payment. This date is considered as the reference date from which the residence and retention period is calculated for Data Retention Manager.

town.description: City, town, village. A value from a codelist for towns (see ISO 19160-4 definition).

district.description: An addressable area inside of a town (see ISO 19160-4 definition: optional).

primaryRegion.description: Code list with codes that are _derived_ from subdivisions. A region for postal must provide a disjoint cut, in ISO 3166-2 it is not always the case (for example, France 14 provinces, 95 departments, departments intersect with provinces). This means that additional work must be invested in curation of ISO 3166-2 code lists. So, while formally it the field type is ISO subdivision code, in fact it is a curated subset of ISO 3166-2, prepared for use in postal delivery.

secondaryRegion.description: Locally governed region name second level, optionally codelist item.

tertiaryRegion.description: Locally governed region name third level (for example, Russia), optionally codelist item.

country.description: A value from a codelist for countries/regions.

postCode.description: Postal code (or Zip Code in the US, PLZ in Germany, and so on).

deliveryType.description: A codelist containing a discriminator to select between address types.

deliveryServiceType.description: A codelist containing a discriminator to select between address types.

deliveryServiceQualifier.description: For example, Post Office SouthEast. Needed as the same service identifier is only unique within the scope of the qualifier (that is, the same identifier could be used in different post offices in the same town).

deliveryServiceIdentifier.description: Identifier of the delivery service, for example, the number of the PO Box. Unique within the scope of the deliveryServiceQualifier.
